ghost

Class AssetManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.AssetManager

  • public class AssetManager
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AssetManager(App app)
      Constructs an asset manager which holds assets and information of the game, such as the length of Ghost modes, whether the game as won or not, and controls debugging mode.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void death()
      Sets the death timer to -600 (counts upwards only) and resets the game by calling this.app.setup()
      int draw()
      Draws the assets of the game, including the player, all ghosts, and the arena by calling each entity separately to draw themselves.
      Arena getArena()
      Returns the arena object of the game, where the grid of cells are stored.
      int getFrightenedLength()
      Returns the frightened length of ghosts, in seconds.
      java.util.List<Ghost> getGhosts()
      Returns the list of ghosts in the game.
      Waka getPlayer()
      Returns the player of the game.
      boolean isDebug()
      Returns whether the debug mode is currently on.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Returns if the game is currently over, i.e.
      void parseConfig()
      Parses the configuration file, extracting game parameters from it.
      boolean userInput(char key, int keyCode)
      Takes in user input and triggers Waka to respond.
      void win()
      Set the game win status to true.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssetManager

        public AssetManager(App app)
        Constructs an asset manager which holds assets and information of the game, such as the length of Ghost modes, whether the game as won or not, and controls debugging mode. Player and the Ghosts are also stored here.
        Parameters:
        app - App file for passing along to Player and Ghosts for drawing

    • Method Detail

      • parseConfig

        public void parseConfig()
        Parses the configuration file, extracting game parameters from it. Reads in the player's lives, speed, modeLengths for ghosts, frightened length and creates all game entities, including player and ghosts.

      • getArena

        public Arena getArena()
        Returns the arena object of the game, where the grid of cells are stored.
        Returns:
        arena of the game

      • getGhosts

        public java.util.List<Ghost> getGhosts()
        Returns the list of ghosts in the game.
        Returns:
        the list of ghosts in the game

      • getPlayer

        public Waka getPlayer()
        Returns the player of the game.
        Returns:
        the player of the game

      • getFrightenedLength

        public int getFrightenedLength()
        Returns the frightened length of ghosts, in seconds.
        Returns:
        frightened length of ghosts

      • death

        public void death()
        Sets the death timer to -600 (counts upwards only) and resets the game by calling this.app.setup()

      • draw

        public int draw()
        Draws the assets of the game, including the player, all ghosts, and the arena by calling each entity separately to draw themselves. If the player dies then draws the game over screen for 10 seconds or until death timer runs out. If the player wins, then display the win screen.
        Returns:
        1, -1, or 0 symbolising winscreen, deathscreen, gameplay.

      • userInput

        public boolean userInput(char key,
                         int keyCode)
        Takes in user input and triggers Waka to respond. If space is pressed, debug mode is activated. Returns false if currently the game is over.
        Parameters:
        key - the char to check for CODED keys
        keyCode - the key that was pressed
        Returns:
        true or false, whether input was registered

      • win

        public void win()
        Set the game win status to true.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns if the game is currently over, i.e. the player is dead.
        Returns:
        true if player is dead and game is currently over.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        Returns whether the debug mode is currently on.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is on
